definition: variant of 架勢|架势[jia4 shi5]
to support/frame/rack/framework/classifier for planes, large vehicles, radios etc

sentences.english: Up to seven of these modular units plug into a bookshelf-style card rack.
sentences.chinese: 每个机架式插件板导轨最多可安装7个此模块装置。

sentences.english: Flanking its long body are two outrigger treads that allow the tank to turn.
sentences.chinese: 两条外架式履带在狭长的车身两侧，帮助坦克转向。

sentences.english: Furthermore, scaffolded assistance proved to be essential to the regulatory progression.
sentences.chinese: 也就是说，调节阶段的进步奠基于应架式协助。

sentences.english: So I am dressed like a soldier, too.
sentences.chinese: 那我也得来点儿军人的架式。

sentences.english: The table variety, according to the branch may be in the form of style and two tank.
sentences.chinese: 桌的品种繁多，按形式可分支架式和柜式两种。

sentences.english: The half-elevated arrangement type can be used in old workshop reformation.
sentences.chinese: 对于老车间改造可采用半高架式布置。

sentences.english: The farmer feeds these "battery hens" each day and collects their eggs.
sentences.chinese: 农场主每天给这些层架式鸡笼里的鸡喂食，拾取鸡蛋。

definition: to assume/to adopt (a look, pose, manner etc)/to bring out for display
lit. furrowed brows and blazing eyes/to dart looks of hate at sb (idiom)
to adopt an attitude/to strike a posture
to put one's hands on one's hips
display of wild manners/scandalous scene/insolent and conceited manners
to scowl and stare down/to defy
lit. seeing others go hunting, one is excited by memories of the thrill of the hunt (idiom)/fig. seeing others do what one loves to do, one is inspired to try it again
like a hungry tiger pouncing on its prey
variant of 姿勢|姿势[zi1 shi4]
